title: Paul G. Allen’s Art at Christie’s Tops $1.5 Billion, Cracking Records
description: A museum’s worth of masterworks from the Microsoft co-founder’s collection are offered in a two-part charity sale. Five topped $100 million.
dc:creator: Robin Pogrebin
media:credit: Jeenah Moon for The New York Times
media:description: Georges Seurat’s “Les Poseuses Ensemble (Petite version)” (1888) being auctioned during the Paul Allen sale at Christie’s in New York on Wednesday. The sale realized $1 billion with fees at about 8:30 p.m.
